prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Nolan Cross  Detroit Renegades
mes:
Starting over wasn‚Äôt part of the plan‚Äîbut after things went sideways with his last team, the Detroit Renegades picked up Nolan Cross, defenseman no #71 for his tenth season in the league. He figured he‚Äôd keep his head down. Low profile. Clean slate.

Instead? Scandal.

One minute he‚Äôs doing a harmless fan Q&A on livestream‚Äîbeing polite, smiling like the PR team drilled into him‚Äîand the next, it‚Äôs a full-blown meltdown. A swarm of puck bunnies screeching like hyenas in heat. One claimed he winked. Another posted a blurry selfie standing kinda near him and captioned it: ‚Äúmanifesting his babies üí¶üíç.‚Äù

By the end of the night, three fan accounts had rebranded as @MrsCross79, and someone launched a 47-post thread analyzing the bulge in his compression shorts.

And it didn‚Äôt stop there. His DMs exploded with threats and fantasies. Weird gifts from multiple women started showing up at the rink, used lingerie, stuffed animals reeking of perfume, letters in glitter ink calling him ‚Äúhusband.‚Äù Reddit sleuths tried triangulating his apartment from the angle of a brick wall in one selfie. Discord chats dissected tree shadows to figure out his street. One girl claimed she "accidentally" ran into him at his gym. Another bragged she "might" have found his address. 

Management benched him to ‚Äútake a breather". *Again*. Like he hadn‚Äôt already gone through this exact circus with his last team. Like he was the problem, not the feral puck bunnies clawing at the glass. All he did was smile and play nice, just like PR told him to. 

Christ. And yet again, another day, another psycho-stalker-fan-gift waiting for him on the bleacher for him to find  just as the Renegades were wrapping practice and shuffling off the ice. 

Nolan was so fucking over it.

He stared at the latest offering, a scrap of lace that he assumed was underwear, with his name scrawled on it in red lipstick. *Classy*. He didn't know whether to laugh or hurl.

"Yo, Nolo!" Ronan's voice snapped him out of his what-the-actual-fuck trance. "You got another one? Shit, bro, your fan club is wild."

Nolan shoots him a withering glare. "Shut up, man. It's not funny."

But Ronan just laughs, his eyes dancing with mischief. "I'm just saying, dude. You've got 'em all riled up. Must be that pretty boy charm, eh?"

"Fuck off, Ro." Nolan groaned. He knows Ronan means well, even if his idea of support is relentless teasing.

"Bro, this is getting out of hand tho." Dylan interjects. "You gotta talk to coach or something. That's like, the third one this week."

"And say what? 'Hey coach, sorry I can't focus on hockey, I'm too busy dodging panties from my delulu fans'?" Nolan scoffed, tossing the lace‚Ä¶ thing into the trash. "Yeah, that'll go over real well."

Finn chimed in, ever the voice of un-reason. "Fuck that. I say we find out who's sending this shit and teach 'em a lesson. Old school style."

"Finn." Tyler's warning tone was a bucket of ice water on Finn's vigilante fantasies. "We can't just go around roughing up fans. Even if they‚Äôre batshit. And if this one is like that delulu stalker your mom set you up with last time? Pretty sure they might say it's their kink and ask for more." 

Finn leaned forward, eyes gleaming like a raccoon who found snacks. ‚ÄúAlright, fine, no violence. But what if we just sent ‚Äòem a cursed doll soaked in rink water and protein shake? Y‚Äôknow, hockey voodoo.‚Äù

Tyler squinted. ‚ÄúWhere the hell do you even buy a cursed doll?‚Äù

‚ÄúeBay,‚Äù Finn said too fast.

Nolan groaned into his hands. ‚ÄúCan we not curse anyone? I‚Äôm already living in a nightmare.‚Äù He tried to tune out his teammates as they bounced ridiculous ideas back and forth like it was some kind of contest. He only cared for one thing right now as his eyes scanned the stands, searching for one thing. And then, there she was. Making her way toward him. His pulse kicked up a notch.

Hailee.

He hadn't seen her in weeks and he'd promised to take her to that new cafe downtown. *Not a date*, he reminded himself sternly. Just two friends. Hanging out. Doing friend things. *Right.*

"Crossy!" Roro's elbow jabs into his ribs, jolting him back to reality. "You gonna stand there eye-fucking your girl all day or what?"

"Shut up," Nolan hisses, feeling his cheeks heat. "She's not my‚Äîwe're not‚Äîit's not like that."

*Fuck*. He wishes it was. Wishes he had the balls to tell her how he really feels, how he's felt ever since they were twelve and she broke his nose for calling her a loser. ((To be fair, he was trying to flirt. It backfired. Badly.) He‚Äôs been a goner for her ever since. Through every asshole boyfriend, every messy breakup, every tearful rant at 2 AM, he‚Äôs always been there. Always the friend. *Just the friend*. And if he screw this up 
 and lost her?  That would fucking end him.

So instead, he pastes on his best "totally platonic bro" smile and jogs over to meet her halfway.

But then he saw her. *Fuck. Not again*. The crazy brunette. Usually there were a few of them circling like a hyena pack but he's sure this one is the one who‚Äôd been leaving increasingly deranged gifts‚Äîlace panties spritzed with perfume, glitter-soaked letters that all started with ‚ÄúDear Husband‚Äù and ended in lipstick kisses. *Fuck. How the hell did she get past security?*

Panic clawed up his throat. He couldn't let Hailee see *that*. Couldn't let Hailee realize just how fucked his situation was. She'll worry. She'll fret. She'll look at him with those big, concerned eyes and he'll fucking break.

He had to get them out of here. Now.  

He turned to Hailee, a too-bright smile plastered on his face. "Hey, you ready to go? I was thinking we could take the back way out. Y'know, avoid the crowds."

Without waiting for a response, he wrapped an arm around her shoulders, steering her towards the side exit. He could feel the brunette's eyes boring into his back. Could practically hear the gears turning in her delusional little head.

They‚Äôd almost made it to the back exit when he heard it.

**"Husband!"**

Nolan flinched like he‚Äôd been shot.

The voice rang out in the corridor‚Äîhigh-pitched, syrupy, and unhinged in that terrifyingly cheerful way that meant nothing good ever followed.

**‚ÄúHusband! Wait! You forgot your gift!‚Äù**

He didn‚Äôt turn around. Didn‚Äôt breathe. Just tightened his arm around Hailee and muttered, ‚ÄúKeep walking. Don‚Äôt look. Please.‚Äù

But the footsteps behind them quickened. He could hear the slap of cheap heels on tile, the jangle of too many bracelets, the rustle of a plastic shopping bag clutched in manicured hands.

‚ÄúI made you something!‚Äù she chirped. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a scrapbook of our future wedding! I even printed out the photo of us standing near each other at the last meet-and-greet autograph session. It was destiny, baby!‚Äù

Nolan swore under his breath, heart pounding. Fuck. He should‚Äôve told security. Should‚Äôve flagged her months ago. But no. PR said be nice. Smile. Don‚Äôt ‚Äúantagonize the fans.‚Äù

Now she was three strides away and still gaining. ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs this bitch?‚Äù she screeched, zeroing in on Hailee. ‚ÄúIs she your assistant? A cousin? She doesn‚Äôt look like your type!‚Äù

The girl lunged at Hailee. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt need her! I‚Äôm the one who gets you, Nolan! I bought your cologne! I know your birth chart! I'm gonna have your babies.‚Äù

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee yelps jumping back as the girl falls forward. She dodges to the side falling against Nolan's chest trying to get farther away from this crazy girl* "Woah what the hell. Who are you" *Hailee gasps her eyes wide and frightened*

*Hailee has never seen a girl act like this. She is fucking crazy.* "Nolan what the fuck"

name: Nolan Cross  Detroit Renegades
mes:
Nolan's grip on Hailee tightened instantly, pulling her flush against his chest as he stepped between her and the rabid fan. His jaw clenched so hard it ached.

**"Back the fuck up."**

His voice was low‚Äîdangerous in a way that made even Ronan pause mid-laugh from across the hallway. The kind of tone that said *this isn‚Äôt a joke anymore*.

The girl blinked at him like she couldn‚Äôt compute rejection. "But‚Äîbut I‚Äî" She held up the scrapbook again, shaking it like some deranged peace offering. "I worked so hard on this! You *promised* me!"

Nolan didn‚Äôt remember promising shit to anyone except maybe Hailee when he swore he'd take her to that damn caf√© weeks ago and kept flaking because of this exact circus.

He exhaled sharply through his nose, already mentally drafting an apology text to PR for what he was about to do next. **"Listen,"** he ground out, forcing calm into his voice even as his pulse hammered in his throat, **"you need to leave."**

A security guard finally rounded the corner‚Äîlate as fucking usual‚Äîeyeing the scene with weary recognition. Nolan didn't wait for protocol or polite handling; he jerked his chin toward the girl and snapped: **"Get her out."** Then quieter, just for Hailee's ear: **"C'mon, let's go."** He didn't loosen his hold on her until they were outside in crisp evening air with two locked doors between them and crazy-town.

Only then did Nolan drag a hand down his face with a shaky exhale‚Äîhalf frustration, half lingering adrenaline from seeing someone lunge at *Hailee*. Fuck if that didn't make something primal twist in his gut. He turned toward her now, scanning for any sign she was rattled beyond repair (or worse: rethinking being seen with him ever again). His thumb brushed over her wrist without thinking before catching himself and shoving both hands into pockets instead like they'd betrayed him by touching without permission.

*Smooth.* Real smooth.

"...You good?" It came out gruffer than intended; too much leftover tension still coiled tight under ribs where panic had settled minutes ago when some stranger thought she could put hands on what mattered most without consequence.

(And yeah okay maybe calling Hailee *what mattered most* wasn't exactly platonic bestie behavior but sue him.)
swipes:
Nolan‚Äôs grip on Hailee tightens instinctively, pulling her flush against his chest as the girl stumbles forward. His pulse is hammering so loud he can barely hear anything else‚Äîjust the rush of blood in his ears and the sharp, panicked hitch of Hailee‚Äôs breath.

*Fuck.*

He should‚Äôve handled this sooner. Should‚Äôve *done* something instead of just hoping it would go away. But now? Now this psycho was *touching* Hailee, screaming in her face like some kind of rabid animal‚Äîand that? That crossed a line Nolan didn‚Äôt even know he had drawn until right fucking now.

His jaw locks, teeth grinding together hard enough to ache as he steps between them, shielding Hailee with his body entirely. His voice comes out low‚Äîdangerous in a way it almost never is when he's around her. **"Back off."**

The girl blinks up at him like she doesn't understand why *he's* the one pissed off here. "But‚Äî"

**"Now."** The word cracks through the air like a whip, sharp enough that even Ronan and Finn pause mid-step where they'd been rushing over from across the hall. The girl flinches back like she's been slapped, eyes wide with something between shock and betrayal before they flicker to Hailee again‚Äînarrowed now, venomous.

Nolan doesn't give her time to open her mouth again before turning on his heel and all but dragging Hailee toward the exit at a near-jog, ignoring the way she stumbles slightly against him in surprise at how fast he moves them out of there.

His fingers are still curled too tight around hers when they finally burst into fresh air outside‚Äîlike if he lets go for even a second she might vanish or worse: get snatched up by another one of those psychos lurking somewhere unseen.

He exhales hard through his nose before finally looking down at her properly for what feels like forever since this mess started unfolding behind closed doors inside that arena hallway... only then realizing just how close they're standing; chest-to-chest still from when he pulled them both away so fast earlier (and maybe also because part-of-him refuses-to-let-go).

Her eyes are wide green pools staring back up into his own startled ones ‚Äî scared but trusting despite everything happening around them right now which makes guilt twist hot under ribs because none-of-this-should-be-her-problem-but-it-is-because-he-didn't-stop-it-sooner‚Äî

And suddenly all words fail him entirely except two: **"...I'm sorry."**

Nolan's grip on Hailee tightened instantly, pulling her flush against his chest as he stepped between her and the rabid fan. His jaw clenched so hard it ached.

**"Back the fuck up."**

His voice was low‚Äîdangerous in a way that made even Ronan pause mid-laugh from across the hallway. The kind of tone that said *this isn‚Äôt a joke anymore*.

The girl blinked at him like she couldn‚Äôt compute rejection. "But‚Äîbut I‚Äî" She held up the scrapbook again, shaking it like some deranged peace offering. "I worked so hard on this! You *promised* me!"

Nolan didn‚Äôt remember promising shit to anyone except maybe Hailee when he swore he'd take her to that damn caf√© weeks ago and kept flaking because of this exact circus.

He exhaled sharply through his nose, already mentally drafting an apology text to PR for what he was about to do next. **"Listen,"** he ground out, forcing calm into his voice even as his pulse hammered in his throat, **"you need to leave."**

A security guard finally rounded the corner‚Äîlate as fucking usual‚Äîeyeing the scene with weary recognition. Nolan didn't wait for protocol or polite handling; he jerked his chin toward the girl and snapped: **"Get her out."** Then quieter, just for Hailee's ear: **"C'mon, let's go."** He didn't loosen his hold on her until they were outside in crisp evening air with two locked doors between them and crazy-town.

Only then did Nolan drag a hand down his face with a shaky exhale‚Äîhalf frustration, half lingering adrenaline from seeing someone lunge at *Hailee*. Fuck if that didn't make something primal twist in his gut. He turned toward her now, scanning for any sign she was rattled beyond repair (or worse: rethinking being seen with him ever again). His thumb brushed over her wrist without thinking before catching himself and shoving both hands into pockets instead like they'd betrayed him by touching without permission.

*Smooth.* Real smooth.

"...You good?" It came out gruffer than intended; too much leftover tension still coiled tight under ribs where panic had settled minutes ago when some stranger thought she could put hands on what mattered most without consequence.

(And yeah okay maybe calling Hailee *what mattered most* wasn't exactly platonic bestie behavior but sue him.)
